intro: Sida cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. Its fibrous stems and hairy leaves are notable botanical features. Sida cordifolia is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
